fields.summary: [Rust] [Flight] Upgrade to tonic > 0.3.1 to get fix of headers/trailers handling

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Integration

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1211939458

   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17385

alamb commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212132128

   Is there ant reason to hold off merging this PR @lidavidm ? 
   
   I ask because of the somewhat scary sounding commit message `DO NOT MERGE: [Integration] Re-enable Rust integration case` 😅

lidavidm commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212134542

   > Thanks @lidavidm

alamb commented on PR #13852:

   > Testing file middleware
   > ==========================================================
   
   🚀  thanks @lidavidm  and @carols10cents !

alamb merged PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852

lidavidm commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212168164

   …huh, the new merge script uses the original commit and NOT the PR title like I would have expected.

nealrichardson commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212203501

   > …huh, the new merge script uses the original commit and NOT the PR title like I would have expected.
   
   If there's only one commit in the PR, the GitHub PR merge API will use the commit message and not the PR title.

lidavidm commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212205650

   That's a little unfortunate :( I'll have to be more careful about commit messages

nealrichardson commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212210054

   We can probably fix this in the merge script

lidavidm commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212214897

   Hmm, is this worth force-pushing? I guess it hasn't been very long

lidavidm commented on PR #13852:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13852#issuecomment-1212216746

   Or we can revert and push again

lidavidm commented on PR #13852:
